summary: This document is an email chain from July 3, 2020, between a potential witness/victim and FBI officials regarding the Epstein investigation. The witness, who identifies as a rape victim from 20 years prior, is offering information and requesting a secure interview, preferably via Zoom. FBI officials coordinate to have a case agent contact her.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent mentioned in internal coordination about contacting a potential witness.

persons.name: William
persons.role: Assistant Director in Charge, FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: FBI Assistant Director who responds to the witness's initial outreach, explains the investigation process, and coordinates with the Special Agent in Charge.

persons.name: Ms. MEL
persons.context: An individual who emailed the FBI claiming to have information related to a rape she experienced 20 years ago, potentially connected to the Epstein case. She requests a Zoom interview for security and comfort.

connections.description: William, as the FBI Assistant Director, is the primary point of contact responding to Ms. MEL's offer of information and arranging for her to be interviewed by the Epstein task force.
Mandy, an FBI Special Agent, is tasked with making initial contact with Ms. MEL to set up a further discussion.
They are colleagues within the FBI New York Field Office, coordinating on the response to the potential witness.

events.title: Witness Outreach to FBI
events.description: A person using the name Ms. MEL contacts the FBI New York Field Office via email, offering information related to a past rape that may connect to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: FBI Coordination Call
events.description: FBI officials internally coordinate to have a case agent from the Epstein task force contact the potential witness, Ms. MEL.

events.title: Alleged Rape of Witness
events.description: Ms. MEL references being raped approximately 20 years prior to 2020 and indicates she had previously tried to seek justice.

locations: New York (FBI New York Field Office)
West Coast (where the witness, Ms. MEL, is located)
keyFacts: A potential witness/victim, Ms. MEL, contacted the FBI in July 2020 claiming to have information about a rape from 20 years ago that may be relevant to the Epstein investigation.
The witness expressed a strong preference for a Zoom interview over a phone call due to security concerns and past negative online experiences.
FBI Assistant Director William confirmed the Epstein investigation was being handled by a dedicated task force within the New York Field Office.
The witness indicated she had lived under 'provable online threat' for over 20 years, though it had diminished.

The FBI internal correspondence shows standard protocol for handling a sensitive witness, including avoiding LinkedIn for communication and planning an interview that respects the witness's comfort level.
